tagblock.name: Game Engine Event Response List

stringid.name: Display String
stringid.tooltip: This string can use a bunch of neat tokens for substitution of runtime data (e.g. player names). See an engineer for more info.

bit.name: Always Play Sound
bit.tooltip: used for respawn ticks and final tick in halo 3

bit.name: Always Play Sound In MP
bit.tooltip: so you can make multi kill sounds never be suppressed in MP

stringid.name: Primary String
stringid.tooltip: This string can use a bunch of neat tokens for substitution of runtime data (e.g. player names). See an engineer for more info.

float32.name: Sound Delay (Announcer Only)
float32.tooltip: After we commit to playing this sound, wait this long to actually play it. Used to control announcer cadence.

float32.name: Probability
float32.tooltip: Ignored for the default sound - used for sound permutation block entries only.

tagblock.comment: A data-driven way to choose between halo 3 mp's always-queue behavior vs. odst firefight's always-suppress-older-multikills behavior.

stringid.name: Category For Prioritization
stringid.tooltip: which family does this response live in for announcer-spew-suppression? e.g. all multi-kills should use the same string_id here.

float32.name: Priority Suppression Age Maximum Seconds
float32.tooltip: If a sound from this event has been queued for more than this long, it can't be suppressed anymore. Higher values cause a shallower announcer queue for these sounds.

tagblock.comment: A way to say flag taken + flag dropped = silence.

stringid.name: Category For Pair Culling
stringid.tooltip: e.g. flag taken and flag dropped should use the same id here, while ball taken and ball dropped should use another shared id.

int32.name: Pair ID
int32.tooltip: 0 or 1, used to recognized matched pairs. If both a 0 and a 1 are in the queue at the same time, and neither has started playing, both are removed.

float32.name: Delay Before Considering Sound Seconds
float32.tooltip: Used to keep a sound in the queue so later sounds can priority-suppress or pair-suppress it

float32.name: Probability
float32.tooltip: Ignored for the default sound - used for sound permutation block entries only.
